title: James Joyce - Ulysses, Finnegans Wake & more (12 books)
description:
JAMES JOYCE (1882-1941) was an Irish novelist and poet, considered to be one of the most influential writers in the modernist avant-garde of the early 20th century. He is best known for ULYSSES (1922), a landmark work in which the episodes of Homer's Odyssey are paralleled in an array of contrasting literary styles, perhaps most prominent among these the stream of consciousness technique he perfected.  Other major works are the short-story collection DUBLINERS (1914), and the novels A PORTRAIT OF THE ARTIST AS A YOUNG MAN (1916) and FINNEGANS WAKE (1939).


Multiple editions of all these works are included in a mix of PDF and/or ePUB formats as noted:

* CHAMBER MUSIC (Jonathan Cape, 1972). -- ePUB

* DUBLINERS (Oxford World's Classics, 2000).  Edited with an Introduction and Notes by Jeri Johnson. -- ePUB

* DUBLINERS: Text, Criticism, and Notes (Viking Critical Library, 1996).  Edited by Robert Scholes and A. Walton Litz. -- PDF

* EXILES (New Directions, 1945). -- ePUB

* FINNEGANS WAKE (Oxford World's Classics, 2012).  Edited by Robbert-Jan Henkes, Erik Bindervoet, and Finn Fordham. -- PDF

* FINNEGANS WAKE (Penguin Classics, 1992).  Edited with an Introduction by Seamus Deane. -- ePUB

* FINNEGANS WAKE: The Restored Text (Penguin Classics, 2012).  Edited with a Preface and Afterword by Danis Rose and John O'Hanlon, with Appendices by Hans-Walter Gabler and David Greetham. -- ePUB

* GIACOMO JOYCE (Faber & Faber, 1968).  With an Introduction and Notes by Richard Ellmann. -- PDF

* PORTRAIT OF THE ARTIST AS A YOUNG MAN (Oxford World's Classics, 2000).  Edited with an Introduction and Notes by Jeri Johnson. -- ePUB

* PORTRAIT OF THE ARTIST AS A YOUNG MAN & DUBLINERS (Barnes & Noble, 2004).  With an Introduction and Notes by Kevin J. H. Dettmar. -- PDF + ePUB

* ULYSSES (Vintage, 1993).  Edited by Hans-Walter Gabler with Wolfhard Steppe and Claus Melchior, and an Afterword by Michael Groden. -- PDF

* ULYSSES (Penguin Classics, 1992).  With an Introduction by Declan Kiberd. -- PDF + ePUB
